H0.text: Sharp claws are an adaptation most likely resulting from snowy owls living in very cold areas.

H1.text: Curved beaks are an adaptation most likely resulting from snowy owls living in very cold areas.

H2.text: Large, yellow eyes are an adaptation most likely resulting from living in very cold areas, as seen in snowy owls.

H3.text: Thick, white feathers are an adaptation that snowy owls likely have as a result of living in very cold areas.

A4.text: The snowy owl has perhaps the second lowest thermal conduction to the plumage on average of any bird after only the Adelie penguin
